item.title: My thinking in 3rd term has changed vastly in terms of vision, scope: PM Modi on podcast with Nikhil Kama - The Times of India
item.description:
My thinking in 3rd term has changed vastly in terms of vision, scope: PM Modi on podcast with Nikhil Kamath

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Prime Minister Narendra Modi discusses the evolution of his vision and approach in his third term during a podcast with entrepreneur Nikhil Kamath. He elaborates on the changes in his thought process and the broader implications for governance.

  • Modi emphasizes a significant shift in his perspective since starting his third term.
  • The Prime Minister talks about adapting to new challenges and visions for India's future.
  • He highlights the importance of encompassing a wider scope in governance.
“My vision has expanded, and I recognize the need for a broader approach in governance.”

Modi's comments underline his proactive stance on adjusting to evolving political landscapes and societal needs.

item.title: Donald Trump 1st US President To Be Sentenced As Felon, But Avoids Jail, Penalty - NDTV
item.description:
Donald Trump Becomes First US President Sentenced as Felon, Escapes Jail Time

Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: NDTV

Donald Trump has made history by becoming the first felon in the White House, as a US court upholds his conviction in a hush money case. Although he was sentenced to an 'unconditional discharge', he will not serve jail time due to his position as President-elect.

  • Trump was convicted of falsifying business records related to payments made to Stormy Daniels.
  • He faced potential jail time of four years but was spared due to presidential immunity.
  • Judge Juan Merchan described the circumstances as unique and remarked on the legal implications of sentencing a sitting president.
  • Trump did not attend the court session in person and instead appeared virtually.
  • He characterized the legal proceedings as damaging to his reputation and a setback for the New York court system.
"This court has determined that the only lawful sentence that permits entry of a judgement of conviction without encroaching on the highest office of the land, is an unconditional discharge." - Judge Juan Merchan
"It was done to damage my reputation, just so that I may lose the election." - Donald Trump

In a significant ruling, this event illustrates the complexities of legal accountability at the highest levels of government, setting a precedent for the future.

item.title: US to impose sanctions on Russian oil fleet and traders, document shows - Reuters
item.description:
US to impose sanctions on Russian oil fleet and traders, document shows

Publication Date: January 10, 2023
Source: Reuters

The United States plans to impose stringent sanctions on Russia's oil industry, affecting around 180 ships and multiple traders. This move follows ongoing tensions due to the Ukraine war and could significantly disrupt Russian oil exports to major buyers like India and China.

  • Sanctions target around 180 ships, dozens of traders
  • Gazprom Neft, Surgut, ship insurers added to the list
  • Biden team had sought to avoid price spike
  • New Trump administration has said will seek to end Ukraine war
  • Reuters could not immediately verify the document
According to the document, the U.S. Treasury would allow a transition period to March 12, allowing some energy-related transactions to be completed.

This action represents a significant escalation in U.S. efforts to minimize Russia's capacity to fund its military actions through oil exports.

item.title: Woman from Myanmar undergoes liver transplant at hospital in Chennai - The Hindu
item.description:
Woman from Myanmar undergoes liver transplant at hospital in Chennai

Published: January 10, 2025 08:51 pm IST

A 66-year-old woman from Myanmar underwent a liver transplant surgery at a private hospital in Chennai after being diagnosed with advanced liver disease.

  • The woman suffered from ascites, pedal oedema, and jaundice due to hepatitis C virus-induced hepatocellular carcinoma.
  • The surgery was led by Magnus Jayaraj and Karthik Raj M. at GEM Hospitals.
  • A living donor liver transplant was performed with her niece donating a part of her liver.
  • The patient is now recovering and preparing to return to Myanmar.

item.title: Hush money case: US judge sentences Donald Trump, declines to impose jail term, fine - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Donald Trump Sentenced in Hush Money Case

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A US judge sentenced President-elect Donald Trump over a criminal conviction related to hush money paid to a porn star. The verdict marks the first felony conviction for a US president, but Trump will not face jail or a fine.

  • The judge imposed the mildest criminal sanction available: an unconditional discharge.
  • Judge Juan M Merchan cited unique circumstances surrounding the case.
  • Trump was convicted on 34 counts of falsifying business records.
  • He claims the conviction is intended to sabotage his presidential campaign.
"Never before has this court been presented with such a unique and remarkable set of circumstances." - Judge Juan M Merchan

The case revolves around a payment of $130,000 to Stormy Daniels, made to suppress disclosure about an alleged encounter during Trump's 2016 campaign. Trump denied the encounter and claimed the verdict was politically motivated.

item.title: 45-minute sauna lands woman in hospital due to heat stroke - The Times of India
item.description:
Woman Hospitalized After Sauna Session Leads to Heat Stroke

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: [Insert Source Here]

A woman in her early 70s was admitted to a hospital in the UK after suffering heat stroke due to a 45-minute sauna session. Her body temperature soared to 107.6°F, significantly surpassing normal levels, leading to severe health complications.

  • The woman fainted after her sauna session and was hospitalized.
  • Her elevated body temperature posed risks of brain damage.
  • Vital signs showed reduced blood pressure and accelerated heart rate.
  • Diagnosed with severe exertional heat, she required immediate treatment.
  • After treatment, her temperature normalized, but she faced significant health threats.
  • She made a full recovery after 12 days in the hospital, without need for advanced organ support.
"If not treated within an hour, heat stroke can be fatal leading to death."

In conclusion, understanding the dangers of prolonged heat exposure is crucial, as immediate actions can save lives in heat stroke situations.

item.title: Tech wrap Jan 10: Xiaomi Pad 7 launch, OnePlus 13 sale, DailyObjects LOOP - Business Standard
item.description:
Tech wrap Jan 10: Xiaomi Pad 7 launch, OnePlus 13 sale, DailyObjects LOOP

Publication Date: January 10, 2023

Source: Unknown

This article covers the latest tech news including the launch of the Xiaomi Pad 7 and OnePlus 13 in India and new products from DailyObjects.

  • Xiaomi Pad 7: Features Qualcomm Snapdragon 7 Plus Gen 3, available with a Nano Texture Display and runs on HyperOS 2.
  • OnePlus 13: Launched on January 7, powered by Snapdragon 8 Elite, equipped with Hasselblad camera, running Oxygen OS 15.
  • DailyObjects LOOP: New series of MagSafe-compatible power banks, Qi2-certified, with 15W wireless charging.
  • Redmi 14C 5G: Up for sale in India starting at Rs 9,999, featuring dual 5G support and premium design.
  • Google AI Podcast: Testing personalized daily podcasts feature called Daily Listen.
  • Meta's Content Moderation Changes: Increased searches on deleting accounts following changes in moderation policy.
  • Meta Discontinuation: Ending third-party fact-checking in the US, shifting to user-generated Community Notes.

item.title: OnePlus 13 series is now available for purchase: Price in India, offers and more - The Times of India
item.description:
OnePlus 13 series is now available for purchase: Price in India, offers and more

Publication Date: [Date not provided] | Source: Times of India

The OnePlus 13 series has officially launched and is now available for purchase in India, featuring several new offers and pricing details for customers.

  • Launch of OnePlus 13 series models.
  • Competitive pricing aimed at the midrange smartphone market.
  • Various promotional offers on specific models.
  • Positive reception among tech enthusiasts and early buyers.
“The OnePlus 13 offers exceptional value in performance and features.”

This series aims to strengthen OnePlus's position in a competitive market, offering customers high-end specifications at accessible prices.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 series full specs leaked ahead of January 22 Unpacked event: Details - The Financial Express
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Series Full Specs Leaked Ahead of January 22 Unpacked Event

Publication Date: January 15, 2024

Source: Financial Express

The Galaxy S25 series is set for launch soon, and leaks reveal detailed specifications for the Galaxy S25, Galaxy S25+, and Galaxy S25 Ultra models, including their display, performance, and camera features.

Key Points

  • The Galaxy S25 features a 6.2-inch Dynamic AMOLED 2X display with Full HD+ (2340 x 1080) resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate.
  • It is powered by the Snapdragon 8 Elite for Galaxy chipset with 12GB of RAM and storage options of 128GB, 256GB, and 512GB.
  • Camera setup includes a 50MP primary, 12MP ultrawide, and 10MP telephoto lens with OIS.
  • Battery capacity stands at 4,000mAh with 25W wired fast charging and wireless charging support.
  • The Galaxy S25+ has a larger screen at 6.7 inches, WQHD resolution, a bigger 4,900mAh battery, and similar camera specifications.
  • The flagship Galaxy S25 Ultra includes a 6.9-inch display, advanced 200MP camera, and a capacity of up to 1TB storage.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

The S25 Ultra model features the highest level of detail and color accuracy with its massive 6.9-inch display and exceptional camera capabilities.

The phone runs on Android 15 with Samsung’s One UI 7 for a user-friendly experience.

item.title: Third HMPV case reported from Ahmedabad, state tally reaches four - Gujarat Samachar
item.description:
Third HMPV Case Reported in Ahmedabad, Tally Reaches Four in Gujarat

Publication Date: Friday | Source: Gujarat Samachar

A new HMPV case has been reported from Ahmedabad, bringing the state's total to four cases. This incident marks the third reported case from Ahmedabad.

  • The latest patient is a nine-month-old infant transferred from Viha Children’s Hospital to Childhood Hospital.
  • The previous case involved an 80-year-old man who tested positive and was admitted to Sterling Hospital.
  • Three cases of HMPV have been confirmed in Ahmedabad and one in Prantij.
  • HMPV is a respiratory virus that tends to peak in winter, particularly affecting young children and the elderly.
  • Advisory issued by the state urges citizens to follow health guidelines to combat respiratory infections.
“Metapneumovirus (HMPV) is similar to other respiratory viruses, and it's crucial to maintain hygiene and avoid crowded places to prevent infection.”

Citizens are advised to cover their mouths when sneezing, wash hands regularly, and seek medical attention if they exhibit respiratory symptoms.

item.title: 6 Very Beautiful Images Of Moon Taken By NASA - Times Now
item.description:
6 Very Beautiful Images Of Moon Taken By NASA

Publication Date: January 10, 2025, Source: Times Now

This article showcases six breathtaking images of the Moon captured by NASA, highlighting the beauty and intrigue of Earth's natural satellite.

  • 2017 Total Solar Eclipse image showing the Sun's corona.
  • Full Moon photo taken from the International Space Station.
  • Unique perspective of the Moon by NASA's MESSENGER spacecraft.
  • Tycho Crater captured by the Hubble Space Telescope.
  • Oblique view of the Copernicus crater taken by Lunar Orbiter 2.
  • Image of the Moon captured by NASA’s Galileo spacecraft in 1992.
“These images aid in understanding the physics and structure of the Moon, showcasing its beauty and our capabilities of capturing it from various spaces.”

This collection of images not only emphasizes the aesthetic appeal of the Moon but also engages audiences in lunar exploration and science.

item.title: IND-W vs IRE-W Highlights (1/10/2025): IND-W beat IRE-W by 6 wickets, IND-W vs IRE-W Full Scorecard - Hindustan Times
item.description:
IND-W vs IRE-W Highlights (1/10/2025): IND-W beat IRE-W by 6 wickets

Publication Date: 1/10/2025

Source: Sports News

India Women (IND-W) defeated Ireland Women (IRE-W) by 6 wickets in the first ODI of the series. The match showcased notable performances from both teams, with Ireland's captain Gaby Lewis scoring 92 runs and IND-W's Pratika Rawal being named Player of the Match for her batting excellence.

  • IND-W successfully chased down a target of 239 runs set by IRE-W.
  • Pratika Rawal played a critical role in the chase and was recognized for her performance.
  • Smriti Mandhana praised the team’s bowlers for their efforts on a challenging pitch.
  • Despite 56/4, Ireland managed to set a competitive total aided by a strong partnership.
  • The teams are set to meet again on January 12 for the second ODI.
“Every game holds equal importance.” - Smriti Mandhana

The match highlights the strengths and areas for improvement for both teams as they prepare for future games in the series.

item.title: When Salim Khan revealed why marital bliss has always evaded Salman Khan - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Salim Khan Explains Why Salman Khan Remains Single

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a candid revelation, Salim Khan shared insights into why his son, Salman Khan, has never married, despite being one of Bollywood's most eligible bachelors. Salim pointed out a disconnect between Salman’s ideal of a partner and the type of women he tends to attract.

  • Salman Khan, turning 60 soon, remains one of Bollywood's most eligible bachelors.
  • Salim Khan stated that Salman’s attraction to glamorous actresses complicates his search for a partner resembling his mother.
  • According to Salim, the discrepancy in Salman's expectations and reality contributes to his single status.
  • Salman is set to appear in the upcoming film Sikandar, releasing this March.
“There is a contradiction in Salman’s thinking, which is one of the reasons why he’s not married…” - Salim Khan

This insight sheds light on Salman Khan's prolonged bachelorhood and the complexities surrounding his relationships.

item.title: "Gautam Gambhir Lagging Behind...": Coach's Every Error In Australia Tour Brutally Singled Out - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir Lagging Behind...: Coach's Every Error In Australia Tour Brutally Singled Out

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: NDTV

Indian cricket team head coach Gautam Gambhir faces criticism after his team's losses against New Zealand and Australia. Former teammate Mohammad Kaif has pointed out several tactical errors made by Gambhir during the Australia tour.

  • Gambhir has received backlash for back-to-back Test series losses.
  • Mohammad Kaif expressed concerns over Gambhir's tactics in a viral video.
  • Kaif questioned Gambhir's decisions regarding player selections in key matches.
  • The BCCI plans to review Gambhir's performance along with captain Rohit Sharma.
“The best coach is always the one who is tactically No. 1,” Kaif stated, emphasizing the need for Gambhir to justify his decisions.

Criticism of Gambhir's coaching abilities raises questions about the future of the Indian cricket team and its strategy moving forward.

item.title: ‘Avoid panic’: Amid HMPV scare, Pune district collector calls for taking precautionary measures - The Indian Express
item.description:
Pune District Collector Addresses HMPV Concerns, Urges Calm and Precautions

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

Pune District Collector Jitendra Dudi has reassured citizens regarding the Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV), stating that it is not a new threat and advising against panic. He emphasized the importance of basic health precautions.

  • The district saw around 20 HMPV cases in the pediatric group and 4-5 cases in adults.
  • No unusual surge in respiratory illnesses associated with HMPV has been reported in the country.
  • Dr. Aarti Kinikar noted that the last HMPV case in Pune was detected on November 28 of last year.
  • The state has increased surveillance due to an outbreak in China.
  • A total of 48,019 individuals with suspected symptoms were screened in Maharashtra recently.
“This is not a new virus and we have urged people not to panic.” - Jitendra Dudi

Health officials stress the need for calm as the situation develops; monitoring will continue to ensure public safety.

item.title: Yogi Adityanath's ‘denting-painting’ warning to Waqf ahead of Maha Kumbh 2025 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Yogi Adityanath's Warning to Waqf Ahead of Maha Kumbh 2025

Date: January 10, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Maha Kumbh is being celebrated after 12 years, with a huge turnout of devotees expected in Prayagraj from January 13 to February 26.

  • Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath issued a warning to the Waqf Board regarding land claims ahead of the Maha Kumbh.
  • He stated that anyone wishing to claim land would face consequences, referring to 'denting-painting'.
  • Adityanath welcomed those respecting Indian traditions but criticized claims from the Waqf Board regarding land issues.
  • The statement comes after an AIMJ president's claim about land rights and entry for Muslims during the Kumbh Mela preparations.
  • No discrimination during the Maha Kumbh was promised by Adityanath, but he affirmed the reclaiming of Waqf land.
  • The event is anticipated to attract over 45 crore devotees.
“The Kumbh has been a symbol of India's heritage for thousands of years and has always taken place here.”

The Maha Kumbh 2025 is expected to be a significant event, marking a major spiritual gathering with a large influx of devotees in Prayagraj.

item.title: Who would be Narendra Modi's first call after his happiest moment? PM answers - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Who would be Narendra Modi's first call after his happiest moment? PM answers

Date: Jan 10, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In his first podcast appearance, Prime Minister Narendra Modi shared that his mother would have been the first person he would call during his happiest moment. He reflected on significant events in his life and emphasized the importance of family.

  • PM Modi discussed personal moments, including a pivotal call to his mother after hoisting the Indian flag at Lal Chowk in Srinagar.
  • He recalled his experience during an attack on his convoy in Punjab and the emotional significance of the call.
  • Modi talked about his childhood, political challenges, and lessons learned along the way.
  • The Prime Minister acknowledged his humanity and the inevitability of making mistakes.
“For me, it was a moment of joy and I also thought that my mother would have been worried.” - PM Narendra Modi

This podcast marks an intimate look at Modi's thoughts on family, politics, and his life experiences.

item.title: Sambhal mosque well row: SC orders status quo, issues notice to Centre, ASI - The Hindu
item.description:
Supreme Court Orders Status Quo on Sambhal Mosque Well Dispute

Date: January 10, 2025   Source: The Hindu

In a significant ruling, the Supreme Court has ordered a status quo on the controversy surrounding a private well near the Mughal-era Jama Masjid mosque in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh, while issuing notices to relevant authorities.

  • The Supreme Court intervened to order a status quo regarding a private well claimed by the mosque's management committee.
  • Notices were issued to the Centre, ASI, and private individuals involved in the case.
  • The dispute arose from the district administration's initiative to revive old temples and wells, which included the contested well.
  • Concerns of historical significance and potential violence surrounding the site prompted the Supreme Court's urgent intervention.
  • Previous violence related to the well had resulted in fatalities, leading to the need for judicial action.
“We have been drawing water from the well since time immemorial.” - Huzefa Ahmadi, Senior Advocate

The Supreme Court's decision highlights its role in maintaining peace and harmony amid contentious religious disputes and emphasizes the importance of ensuring due process in legal proceedings regarding historically significant sites.
